Flew SIN-MNL-SIN. SIN-MNL was good. The FAs are really nice. Food is superb. MNL-SIN is okay. FAs for the return flight are not as pleasant as the SIN-MNL leg. Food is still superb. Both sectors used new A320 planes which don't have personal screens. There's an overhead screen though. The seats are a bit cramped. I feel like I'm flying on an LCC.
Great service non stop LHR to Manila and back. Flights on time staff pleasant and efficient. Will only use this airline for future trips to Philippines!

I was going to Boracay in April and came back to Hong Kong with 1 stop over at Manila. We flew a 747-400 jumbo jet for an old plane the cabin looked clean and new. There was AVOD/IFE capability personal TV screens it worked well and cabin staff were warm and friendly and the food was good. There was one slight problem though it was delayed for about 30 minutes to 1 hour. I would definitely fly them again the flight was quite full. The 747 is absolutely the queen of the skies.

Very good experience over all. Being married to a Filipino we find travel by PAL the most convenient. On trips from Toronto to Manila and back there is a short stop in Vancouver and back on the same plane. Flight attendants stewardesses and all others were friendly and helpful. On arrival to Vancouver my wife and I were moved to business class for the remainder of the trip to Manila free of charge. All in all a really good travel experience. My one complaint if I could think of any would be the food although that would be very nit picking of me. I'm not a big fan of Filipino foods though the ones they served I'm sure were prepared well. My wife enjoyed what they served as well as I'm sure 99% of the other people on board. My opinion on food should not be important here perhaps because most who fly this airline will love the food. We will continue to fly PAL when ever possible and build up our air miles. So far it has been a really good experience for us and everything has been as advertised or better.

In April this year by boyfriend and I flew Philippine Airlines and without a doubt the worst most disorganised airline I've ever traveled with. First the flights were rescheduled to nearly 4 hours earlier than originally planned and we were not notified no email no call nothing. I only found out because I checked the airport flight times to see what gate we would have to board from. My boyfriend and I were both travelling on connecting flights which meant we would not make our new flight times. We had to rearrange our connecting flights and fork out a lot of money to change these. Secondly online states that everyone will have ipads to watch TV/movies on. No this was not the case either. There were 3 TV's in our section of they plane and I'm not talking out 3 TV's per row I'm talking about 3 TV's for the entire section. Also these TV's were not made in the 2000's they were at least 20+ years old. I felt like I was watching a video rather than a DVD or anything of quality. All in all worst experience I've had with an airline.

Return trip (4 sectors) with transit in Manila experienced delays of between 15 minutes to 2 hours. When final connection could not be made staff rebooked the next delay resulting in 11 hour overnight transit in Manila. When I requested where I would be accommodated they advised I would have to wait in terminal! After an hour of arguing and being told that no managers are available they acknowledged they would accommodate me in Manila overnight with transport and meals. Accommodation was appalling. I am sorry PAL passengers are customers maybe you could notify your staff about this.

PR430 from MNL-NRT was operated by an A321-200 registered as RP-C9906. There were no delays and luggage came out just after immigration at Narita. The plane was hot the leather seats are too warm and not comfortable. There was no IFE nor PTV's even iPad's were not available. The food was very bad. I will never fly PAL's A321 again.

I am a regular business cabin flier usually clocking up between 4 and 5 long haul flights a month. I flew Philippine airlines Jakarta to Manila and Manila to London on July 5 2014. The latter leg is a 14.5 hour flight. Having read some of the reviews on this site I was an exceptionally reluctant flier and in fact protested belatedly at the choice of airline. I will be apologising to my agent for my complaints. The service on the flight was exceptional staff were professional courteous and always helpful in spite of some difficult requests (I chose to anticipate change in time zones by sleeping and eating at all the wrong times). The food was great wine was good cabin and toilets spotless. Although the seats don't recline all the way it is flat bed at a slight angle and perfectly acceptable for sleeping. They have a relatively sparse choice of inflight movies and shows only somewhat compensated for with loan iPads for the flight with additional choices so if are a big consumer of inflight entertainment it may be worth bringing your own especially given the length of the flight. Both flights were on time transfer at Manila faultless if surprisingly personal (escort for most of it) - this in spite of only a 1hour 10 minute layover. Check-in at Jakarta is through a dedicated business class channel which includes immigration. In all a great experience. I realise two flights don't make a big sample but I am happy to recommend until I experience differently.

PR501 MNL-SIN 1 Jul 14. Flight was delayed 2 hours they were to rebook me on Singapore Airlines flying out of T1 at 16.50 but the check in counter had already closed and they apologized to me. However I had noticed a spark of attitude shown towards me by the Ground Staff at Philippine Airlines. Paid 100SGD to change the flight to an earlier date and time so with the delay I was rather angry and frustrated at them. They had changed the aircraft in use nearly 4 times. Departed at 6 instead of original 3.30pm. Have to say crew and the flight to Singapore was good. PAL needs to work on their ground crew customer service.

Flight PR502 SIN-MNL. Inbound Aircraft had a sight delay other than that fantastic for the boarding welcome by the crew and the service received. Inflight meal was fantastic paid additional 20SGD for the Front Row extra legroom. This seat offered as forward seating choice economy seat. IFE needs some work though overhead screens are too old for the current generation and instead all seats should be equipped with IFE'S. Will fly them again.

On February 10 I flew from SFO on PR105 which was initially supposed to be a direct flight to Manila. Upon arriving at SFO we were instructed that we had to make a "tech stop" in Guam. My first concern was not making it on time in Manila to make my connecting flight but we were notified that the flight was going to arrive in Manila around 5.30am. So then the flight left but encountered a 2hr delay in flying out of SFO. We made our 'tech stop' in Guam but then arrived Manila around 7.30am instead of the previously scheduled time which was 5.30am. As a result I missed my connecting flight with another airline and had to purchase another ticket to flight out of Manila. My original flight was PR105 SFO to Manila arriving at 3.30am!

CEB-MNL - normally fly Business class but when booking my ticket 2 months in advance surprised that my agent said no Business class available. But on the 17th when I flew there was indeed business class but this cabin had been taken up by PAL employee trainees by the looks of things so they have no sense of putting the paying passengers/Mabuhay flyers first in this cabin. So to any business class passenger be warned you maybe bumped into Economy.

MNL-LHR-MNL in business class. We flew on PAL's new 777 but the cabin looks old. Both on the way to LHR and back to MNL the controls to the AVOD did not work. The headphones also had problems. Limited movie selection. The seats do not lie fully flat there is a slight angle. The food is good but the portions are small. On the way back they ran out of choices. On the LHR-MNL leg it appeared that the FAs were new on the job and appeared nervous were stumbling a lot and did not know how to properly serve.

BKK-MNL. Older A330 but immaculately clean inside. Nice lunch including ice cream. IFE on overhead monitors rather than seat back TV screen. Not much full service competition on this route only other choices being Thai or Kuwait Airways. PAL were the cheapest and I was very happy with them will definitely use again.

My wife and I have flown between the US and Manila-Cebu several times. We always fly Philippine Airlines as the service and non-stop flight from LAX to MAN is unequalled by other airlines. Overall we have been very happy with the service of PAL with one exception: The Airport at Manila is intolerable. There is now no Air Conditioning in most of the terminals as those in charge of this airport have let these units go into disrepair. We are seriously considering changing to another airline that fly's directly into Cebu to avoid the Manila Airport. If this does not change this year we will not be flying Philippine Airlines again.

RUH-MNL in a single all-Y-class configuration. Plane was a new A330 high density configuration meaning seats are cramped. No entertainment for 9.5 hours direct flight. Food was OK though and punctuality is commendable.

Rating Philippine Airlines is like rating two separate airlines. My wife and I flew Bacolod - Manila - Hong Kong return out May 24 return May 28. In common with all recent flights there were very long delays in and out of Manila on PAL Express and a complete inability to keep passengers informed. I eventually left the Bacolod departure lounge and spoke to the very charming apologetic and unimpressive station manager to suggest they at least update the flight departure time with their best estimate and employ someone who spoke clearly on the communication system. Again in common with my recent experience the international flights were punctual. Along with many other passengers we were so cold on the flights we asked for blankets - on both flights they ran out!! The apologetic hostess explained this had been reported many times but "passenger feedback reports were not being acted upon". I am booked to Thailand in June and London in September and am fearing the worst for delays - I will bring my own blanket.

MNL-CEB return. A330 both ways delayed both ways. One hour on the MNL-CEB leg and almost 3 hours on the CEB MNL leg. Seats were cramped service (which was supposed to set it apart from "budget airlines") consisted of inedible nuts and warm water (or coffee). Since domestic routes were taken over by PAL express they did away with business class and started treating passengers like cattle. I can't find any justification choosing PR over Cebu Pacific in the domestic route.

Bangkok-Manila-Bangkok in business. As expensive as Thai Airways but that is the only comparison. A poor business product in terms of seat food and service. Not worth the money and ground staff at Manila in my opinion not a good advertisement for this airline.

5th April 2014 London to Manila PR721. 7th April 2014 Manila to Puerto PR2781. 15th April 2014 Puerto to Manila PR2782. 15th April 2014 Manila to Davao PR2817. 20th April 2014 Davao to Manila PR2820. 21st April 2014 Manila to London PR720. Four of us flew to the Philippines and out of our 6 flights (2 international and 4 domestic) all were delayed. All our itineraries were affected because of it. Also the PAL domestic flight has 2 terminals which is so inconvenient for the passengers who have local connecting flight from one island to another.

MNL to LAX flight. They have 2 flights to LAX daily now but they have stopped using 747's instead they are using the old AirBus. Old means smelly rest room no personal entertainment and very limited complimentary services. Old leased plane limited to non-existent entertainment system poorly maintained rest rooms and complimentary service that are limited. They are not that cheap there are other airlines that offers the same price and they have newer planes better service and good food. Here's the catch if you want to go on a long haul flight Do you want to ride a 15 yr. old leased Airbus? The only good side is the non-stop flight to LAX and that's it.

Took this flight from SFO-MNL non-stop. I chose this Airline because it was a non-stop flight and I didn't have to worry about transferring my luggage during a connecting flight. Flight attendants didn't smile a lot. It seemed that they looked very tired of what they're doing. Meals were fair but nothing special. The seats were okay but not very comfortable for a 14-hour flight. IFE was very poor. My headphone jack was broken and I could barely hear the movie I was watching. It turned out that the jack in my seat was the problem. Also not all the lavatories were in a working condition. 2 in the middle were out of order 1 lavatory at the back produced a strong odor of cigarette smell. Not all the amenities were complete.

BKK-MNL-TCL-MNL-BKK in December January and April. While the international flights were largely on time (usually delays of about 30 mins) PR does have a horrible on time record on domestic routes. The TCL-MNL flight in December and April was delayed by 3 hours I was lucky to made the BKK connection (rushed in minibus over the tarmac from T3 to T2). On all three trips the MNL-TCL flights were delayed by 1 hour. The excuse is always "late arrival of aircraft" which they claim is beyond their control! Food on the international flights is inedible I rate it the worst airline food I have come across. On my last MNL-BKK flight it was freezing cold - passengers complaining. However they only had 20 blankets for 100+ passengers. I guess I need to look for alternatives.

Never again! We flew Bangkok to Manila. Manila to Cebu and are flying tomorrow Manila to Bangkok. All 3 flights have had the times changed and quite considerably. This is not normally an issue but we have connecting flights. The worst being our flight tomorrow from Manila to Bangkok. It was originally at 14.15 arriving at 16.45 perfect for our connecting flight at 20.45 so we have time to clear immigration and re-check in. Then it was changed to 15.40 arriving in Bangkok at 18.10 which is just about OK for our 20.45 flight bearing in mind we must clear immigration as it's a different unlinked airline booking. Then today the day before I go online to check in (a good job I have) and our flight has been changed to 17.50 arriving in Bangkok at 20.20 which is impossible for our connecting flight. The best PAL have offered is a 'free' change to the 09.35 flight arriving in Bangkok at 12.05. We now lose half a day in Manila and we had planned to do our souvenir shopping then and we now have 8.5 hours at BKK airport. Yes we could go into BKK but we've visited BKK many many times before (we only live in Laos an hour away). I am not impressed. How can an airline change all 3 flights we've booked?

I came back from Manila on March 31 2014 on flight to LAX. As I boarded in NAIA on March 31 2014 the first attendant did not make any courteous comments whatsoever. Her response was rude but I tolerated it because I chose to fly cheap. PAL's Business Class is around $4.000 cheaper than Cathay Pacific and PAL flies direct. Service was not bad and all facilities were working. On our previous LAX-MNL flight the reading light above me wouldn't switch off and like other reviewers have said nothing was done about it. On this leg we paid the $50 for extra leg room in economy and ended up behind the main door with the big hump thereby preventing me from extending my leg forward. We can fly CP or JAL or SA and pay a lot more plus spend more time in the air and on layovers or we can just pay PAL their cheap fares and hope that the next PAL plane we board is newer.

LHR-MNL-LHR. I had to fly to MNL for an emergency. I couldn't get any flight on the usual airlines I fly with specifically Star Alliance member airlines or Emirates. A PAL flight suited my schedule so I booked a flight with them. I was not sure of PAL when I did the booking as it is fairly new to the London market though it is the only airline that offers a direct flight to between LHR and MNL. The day of the flight came. I did a web check in with no frills. When I got to the airport (LHR T4) the longest queue of passengers waiting to check in got my attention: all PAL passengers on the same flight I was about to be in. Luckily I checked in online so I did not have to wait for hours. PAL does not have its own ground staff hence was outsourced with DNATA which Emirates owns. When I got onboard very friendly FAs assisted me and changed my mood. Service really is great may be the same as Singapore Airlines' service. Food is average had 3 services all throughout the flight. Inflight entertainment is good though as not extensive as Emirates' ICE. No complimentary toiletries in flight unlike Asiana. Seats are wider and comfortable unlike seats on Singapore Air's A380s. On my way back to London I am impressed with the service at Centennial Terminal that PAL exclusively uses compared to Terminal 1 which is stressful. The flight was the longest flight i have ever been into - 15 hours. The service was great. In total PAL LHR flight is good value for money and will fly again with them. Hopefully PAL will have its own ground staff at LHR as DNATA staff do not care and gives bad impression on PAL.

3/8/14 we were denied to board our flight from Basco to Manila due to the strong winds. 10 passengers were bumped off including us. Reason given was they needed to reduce the weight of the plane. No assistance were given to find accommodation or a flight out. Told to go to the PAL office in the town and speak to a PAL agent there. The agent offered us a ticket on a flight 2 days later even though they had a flight next day. We were forced to buy tickets from another airline to be able to fly out next day.

We fly PAL regularly from San Francisco London and Tokyo to Bacolod. In January after a meeting in Manila we were to take the 12.30pm flight to Bacolod - which PAL was charging a premium for. Six hours later we arrived in Bacolod at 7.45pm. No offers of a meal premium ticket refund or any customer assistance. We are trying to find alternative airlines to fly. It should be noted however that inflight service has always been good.

I fly LAX-HKG twice a year and am still wondering why my company got tickets with PAL. Starts off 12hr delay at LAX. Every 2 hours they would bump it two more. I live about 30 minutes from the airport and would have gone home if I had known it was going to be 12hrs. Then to add salt to the wound when I landed in HKG and they had lost my luggage. At least they got my luggage to me in Shenzhen about 40 hours later so I feel fortunate. Food and crew were very nice and no complaints there.

Flew from Singapore to Manila. Last group to get on locker space over my seat was full with other passengers excess baggage they had to find a space half way down the plane! Airline should only let 1 carry on the rest should be checked in. Staff didn't care. Flying out to CDO plane was 1.5 hours late taking off same problem again my locker space crammed with other passengers baggage had to put my bag under my seat.

I went on it last summer 2013 with my family from Hong Kong to Manila on an A320. Cabin was clean cabin crew were friendly comfortable seat but poor entertainment system. The food was good and no delays were required. I recommend this for tourists to the Philippines for holidays. It's much better than Cebu Pacific.

Here we sit in Manila airport waiting for our 2.35 in the afternoon flight to Puerto Princessa. It is now 5.45 pm. No compensation offered no excuses offered they do not care they are extremely disorganized we will never use this airline again. The staff working at the customer service desks had no idea what was going on as well as being too busy on their phones to even look up and address us.

MNL - Puerto Princesa - MNL flight using a PAL Express A320. Crew was courteous. Pilots and crew spoke fluent English. Complimentary snacks. No flight entertainment as this was a domestic flight. Both flights to and from were on time.

Paid for 20 domestic flights for a big family travelling within the Philippines and had at least 2 flights delayed by at least 2 hours (9 tickets affected) without any offer of stay i.e lounge access. Requested Lounge access as my flight delay would mean 7 hours out of hotel accommodation and 4 hours in airport but was told Lounge is for first and business class. No manager on customer service would talk to me as were too busy. Embarrassing as they are the national carrier.

Travelled Sydney-Manila return in business class. I was pleasantly surprised - the flight was very comfortable with excellent service comfortable lie-flat seats and was pretty much on time. The only real issue was the poor entertainment system best bring a good book.

I flew to Manila Philippines with PAL last July 2013 and it was the worst airline experience I have had. The crew were not willing to help passengers. Inflight service was slow and did not even offer drinking water during the flight. I asked for one and the flight attendant said "in a while" and never came back. I will not fly this airline again.

MNL-HKG. Chaotic and long waits at Terminal 2. Very friendly check-in. Paying the terminal fee (not knowing why) is not possible to pay with credit card like in Terminal 1 and 3. Flight was delayed for nearly 2 hours. Staff onboard were very friendly few films only (compared to EK or TK) but very delicious food. Seats were ok! In HKG the luggage took a very long time to arrive. I will fly again with PR.

PR731 BKK-MNL Feb 27th. Online booking smooth as was online check-in. At BKK priority Immigration and lounge pass given direct down to THAI Business Lounge D. Far better lounge than the SATS that PAL uses at Changi. Onboard seated beverage requests taken asked for Champagne. 5 min later told they have ran out of Champagne. I ask how is this possible when we are still firmly at the gate. Purser explains PAL is not allowed to restock anywhere other than at home base in Manila. Since Feb 1st they are allowed to load only 2 bottles for Business class for 2 sectors. This A340 had 24 Business class seats 13pax. Outbound had 19 pax and all Champagne was consumed. Purser visibly frustrated by this policy but powerless. Same policy applies even to long-haul flights. Equally Economy is now limited to 120 cans of beer. Running out of Premium Class service items even before departure is ridiculous. This is regrettable because food was good and portions adequate and PAL Cabins Staff in Business is very friendly courteous and attentive. Seating was also comfortable as this was their long-haul A340 (Crew rest area in front Galley). Departure was delayed by about 20min arrival almost on time. Will fly again 2 weeks from now but if the same repeats itself I'm done with PAL.

MNL-BKK-MNL. Flew last summer on an A340. interior are old entertainment is poor (drop down tv monitor only) boarding is delayed by 15 min only (no problem) take off is again delayed by 10 min (not fault of the airline). Flight crew robotic (not consistent with their domestic crew). Return flight is same crew are robotic and not warm but they are professional. PR lags behind other Asian competitor. Will fly them again maybe after rehabilitation is finished.

Brisbane-Darwin-Manila return Mabuhay (Business Class) on Airbus A320. This is a very poor business class product. Seat was an old style recliner seat with a pitch comparable to economy class of other carriers. Seat reclines for about 2 inches and does not have any leg rest making it the most uncomfortable during a 7.5-hour journey. Entertainment is very poor no noise cancellation headphones and no amenity kits were given despite being advertised in the website. Service was attentive but food was very standard. Overall it was a very disappointing experience flying the Mabuhay Class product on this route. Unless they will upgrade their equipment the product is not worth the price.

I flew Bangkok to Manila once a month for business for almost one year unfortunately I don't recall having one single flight on time. The average delay on this route is about 1-2 hours. Whether morning flight or late flight you face the same issue missing your connection no compensation nor accommodation arrangements. I am a gold frequent flyer on Air France China Eastern and Thai Airways from now on I am going to stay away from this airline.

Flight from Cagayan de Oro to Manila plane was clean staff always friendly to the passenger. PAL is really a much better airline than the years before. Snacks coffee and water were offered. All in all a nice flight again with PAL.

YQT-YYZ-MNL-YYZ-YQT in May-June 2013. I had flown through HKG and NRT to get to the Philippines in previous trips. So much easier to make one connection in YYZ rather than having to make 2 connections. Staff were good plane was very good. I paid the $20 for premium economy. Was a newer Boeing 777-300ER with a fair bit of room. (Pro tip: Sit on one of the sides not the middle section.) The warm cloths towards the end of the trip are a nice touch as I usually only get those when I fly in Business Class. Only complaint was not enforcing carry-on restrictions which can get out of hand. Ample baggage allowances. Terminal 2 is better than Terminal 1 but not as good as Terminal 3 IMHO but it's good enough and certainly not the fault of the airline. Immigration and Baggage was probably about an hour but again not the fault of the airline. Flight is overnight which means you arrive early the next day and can start your business or whatever immediately. I have another trip booked on the same route this May 2014 so yes I will be flying again.

YVR-Manila Dec 2013 return in Business class. As always the service was exemplary and we were made to feel welcome by the 2 crew members assigned to us. This was our third time in Business Class with PAL. The food was faultless. I do not know why people complain about their lie flat beds they are comfortable. The new business class lounge in Manila is a huge improvement and is very welcoming airside. The cabin on the 777 was spotless though there was an issue with my pillow not being clean as we boarded in Vancouver but this was changed. The purser approached me to apologise.

I flew business class round trip from LAX to MNL in January/February 2014. The 747 and A340 were older models. The service was excellent and made up for the older generation aircraft. The pilots were also very good with smooth landings. There was moderate turbulence on the way back to LA but the pilots handled it very well.

I have been flying MEL-MNL-MEL and SYD-MNL-SYD for the last 6 months. Initially PAL we're using 777 for both of these routes. Planes were brand new with lie flat beds in business. Since about September PAL have been using older 330/340 planes. Business seats are old and just a little better than economy. Business upgrades have been a waste of money on these. Service though has remained top class throughout the period.

Hong Kong to Manila PR 301 27 Jan 2014. A320 cabin was very confined and there was a long queue for toilets - was nowhere near as pleasant as previous flights taken in their A330. I will make a conscious effort to book PAL flights on their larger aircraft in future.

My husband and I traveled recently from LAX to Manila and back. We are vegans and had called Philippine Airlines twice to confirm our meal requests. On the trip from LAX to Manila we were served excellent vegan meals and the cabin staff were excellent. We had a problem on the return trip. We arrived to Manila airport 3 hours before our flight after traveling 2 hours from our resort. The business class lounge had no vegan or vegetarian food. We walked all the airport food concessions. Not one had any vegetarian food. Then we boarded our flight. The business class stewardess asked us for meal choices and when we said we had requested vegan meals she looked surprised. The Catering manager and his assistant came on board to speak to us to tell us to take the next day flight and the airline would have a meal for us. The only thing I can say is the business class stewardess was excellent. She did her best to find nuts fruits and remove meat and cheese from salads.

YYZ-MNL-BKK on Jan 10 2014. 777 plane fairly new and very clean. Stop in YVR for more passengers and crew change. Then 13.5 hours to Manila. I thought overall the food selection was very good. Nicely presented and well garnished. Seats were comfortable with almost full flat. Was able to sleep and I am a fairly large man. Although the on demand entertainment system worked well I found the selection a little small and the movies somewhat aged The 3.5 hour flight from MNL-BKK was on an A340 that was showing some age. After take off we found the entertainment system did not work. Seems it was ok in economy but Business was not. The FA returned shortly with a stack of I Pads and gave them out. They had music games and movies. Really nice touch. The lounges in both YYZ and MNL were nice with food and WIFI.

I booked 2 domestic return flights Manila-Caticlan/Boracay-Manila and Manila-Busuanga/Coron-Manila. The first one that was also their first flight to Caticlan in the early morning was incredibly delayed whereas their bigger competitor was continuing to announce boarding and boarding to Caticlan/Boracay and to various other domestic destinations. My second flight (from Caticlan to Manila on 2nd January 2014 morning) was also delayed but not too big a delay. My third flight from Manila to Busanga on 2nd January 2014 (afternoon) was cancelled. My fourth flight from Busuanga to Manila on 6th January 2014 (afternoon) was cancelled as the third one. Canceling the above mentioned flights meant one extra night in Manila and one extra night in Coron Town (both paid by Philippine Airlines including return transfers and very small meals both for Dinner and Breakfast). Based on what I experienced directly i.e. my same (afternoon) flight from MNL to Busuanga was canceled also on 1st January 2014 on 6th January both flights from Busuanga to Manila were canceled it seems that at least during the first week of 2014 the route Manila/Busuanga-Manila was operated by Philippine Airlines/PAL express on a Best Effort way so beware! Based on my personal experience if you plan to fly to Busuanga then Cebu Pacific looks like a much more reliable option.

Melbourne to Manila. Aircraft was an old A330 (scheduled to be an old A340 - normally a 777 though). Lounge in MEL is the Air NZ Koru Club lounge - one of the better lounges in Melbourne. Initially delayed for 2 hours due to late arrival of inbound a/c then further delayed by 1/2 hr due to technical problem. Bussed out to plane. Inflight seats are old. Do not recline much - no lie flat beds here. Luckily its a day flight. Service was quite good. Meal was average. Luggage arrived as expected. 4/10 overall.

Business Class from Manila to Tokyo and the only issue I had was their inflight meal portion size. There were two options of either Chicken or Fish I decided to have the fish and the portion size was ridiculous for a business class meal. I am no way a big eater but for a business class flight this should be looked at. The 2 pieces of fish were smaller than a matchbox with only 2 string beans and 2 roast potato balls. I have flown with Singapore Airlines and their business class meal portion size is worthwhile. The solution was - I had mentioned this to the inflight crew and they had offered me another meal which was nice of them to do so and they said they would report this to the catering department. Bottom Line: The overall service for PHP Airlines business class is good and staff are friendly. I enjoyed the experience and would fly with them again but I strongly suggest that the portion size for the business class meals are looked at and adjusted to a suitable size that's worth the fare paid. The overall experience was very good and the service was above average.

I have flown three times for LAX-MNL-CEB-MNL-LAX. Each time has been a good experience. Food was good attendants very friendly and service is excellent. Called by my name. Always use PR103 if you are leaving LAX the other one I think it's PR113 is an A340 without the lie-flats. The 747-400 has the lie-flats.

BKK-Manila-SFO. There is no web check-in. We waited in line for 2 hours in BKK to check in and check bags. We spoke with airline after booking and prepaid for preferred economy seat (bulkhead 31 A and C) when I checked the flight status before leaving for the airport it would not let me check in but it did show our correct seat assignments. After the 2 hour check in process the check in woman handed us boarding passes with different seats. Told that we needed to go upstairs to their airline office and find out about the payment status. We had less than 45 minutes to clear immigration and security before boarding so we ran up. They then informed us that Philippine airlines does not take credit cards over the phone so we could not have prepaid we had to run down to a money exchange to exchange Thai Baht and then go back to the check in counter. I have never encountered a more disorganized and unfriendly airline. We arrived into Manila and it only got worse. We were ushered into a dirty holding area after presenting our boarding passes at the transit desk and then us and a small group of people traveling to SFO were walked into our terminal where our next flight would depart in 4 hours. We then realized that we were completely trapped for 4 hours between 6-10.30pm in a terminal with no food other than a disgusting hot dog stand that only accepted Philippine quezos. It was awful and so dirty. I was told that a request for a vegetarian meal on the flight could only be done in person 4 hours prior to the flight. As soon as I realized the situation I walked up to make my request. They then told me that could only be done 72 hours before! But it cannot be done online because nothing can with this airline. The plane had very narrow seats and was an old 747. I asked the flight attendant about the meal situation. She said she would check and left me with an empty tray with a roll and cup and never returned with anything or an explanation. The only positive was that the pilot did keep us updated with clear communication in English and allowed us to arrive safely as he navigated through some bad turbulence.

MEL-MNL. Check-in was fast as I skipped the main line. Very close to full flight. Departed about 25 minutes late and arrived 20 minutes late Catering in business class extensive and of good quality with the salads particularly enjoyable. It was also great to have cheese and biscuits as part of the offering. In flight entertainment is only available in business class and was only passable. Immigration quick; luggage took another 15 minutes to arrive.

I have been flying PAL for the last 26 years. Still the best local carrier there is and for the past year or so they certainly upped their game with new route and equipment used. I mostly fly with them domestically and never had a problem in check in so far no delays and meals satisfactory for short and mid haul flights probably better the most. T2 is fine. it is well priced and a value for money compared to other airlines especially on mid haul and long. Plus who can beat the baggage allowance. Hopefully they change their A340 and older A330 quickly or have them retrofitted with new products and a better hospitality training on some FA's on long haul especially the older one's or replaced them. Other than that will fly them again.

YVR-MNL MNL-BKK. Excellent service and seat-back entertainment systems. The food was very good and was served often throughout the flight. Transfers were handled quickly in the airport and all connecting flights were made without issue. Seats aren't amazing but are on par with other airlines.

My partner and I traveled from Melbourne Australia last September this was my partner's first trip to Manila. He was appalled at the service onboard. Once the meals were being served he asked if he could have a scotch on the rocks to which the stewardess said very quietly to "have a look " in the kitchen? She came back with a half- empty bottle and her face expression was like "don't tell anyone that we are serving wine beer or any kind of alcohol". Food was alright and not too heavy on the stomach.

I flew from Vancouver to MNL October 5 at 1.40am. This was my first time flying PALs B777. It was a brand new plane compared to their past planes which were A340 or A330. Service was excellent with a very smooth landing.

Flew via their new A321 on a morning flight. The service was excellent which made up for the loss of on-board entertainment. There were not headsets nor movies to watch the entire flight! I hope they solve this as soon as possible.

If you have a choice avoid Economy class in all new Philippine Airlines planes whether Airbus A330-300 or Boeing 777-300ER. Philippine Airlines has installed very narrow 3-3-3 seating in Economy on it's A330-300's (originally designed by Airbus for 2-4-2) and 3-4-3 on it's 777-300ERs (originally designed by Boeing for 3-3-3). The result for passengers is a horrible narrow shoulder-to-shoulder seat making a very claustrophobic and degrading experience for anyone of normal adult size. Since its acquisition by Philippines' San Miguel group Philippine Airlines has turned into a petty-minded low-cost cargo plane for people.

MNL-SYD-MNL. My wife and I left Manila via terminal 2 on 1st November 2013 check in was great no holdups. The Mabuhay Lounge is quite good food adequate and freshly replaced frequently. The flight itself on a 777ER was a night flight and uneventful except the leg rest only came up halfway. The service was very good and the food choices also very good. The return flight was on the 16th November. Check in again very easy. The flight itself was a day flight on a A440 the plane itself although a bit old was ok. The seats were larger than economy but still comfortable but again the footrest would not come up resulting in swollen feet again. However the service was absolutely first class as was the food so this made it worthwhile. PAL have certainly lifted their game over the last few years and I would rank them as equal to any other Asian Airline. Definitely not a 3 star airline but at least a 4 star airline. We are going to Bangkok in December so I will compare that trip to this.

MNL-SIN on new A321. Seat would have been very comfortable if a footrest was provided. As it is your legs just dangle over the edge of the chair with no support. USB power supply provided but no outlet for a laptop. No TVs - not even over head ones or any other inflight entertainment. Crew helpful and attentive toilet kept clean. Dinner was excellent better than I've had on some 5 star airlines. Nice lounge at Manila airport. "B" grade business class but priced accordingly. Will use again if the price is right.

CGK-MNL-CGK flight to MNL departed late due to late arrival from Manila. A319 is used on this route and timing of the flight is a bit inconvenient as you left Jakarta at 1AM and arrived in Manila at 6AM. Aircraft is clean and well maintained no PTV but overhead screen is available. Returning from Manila in a more convenient morning flight arriving in Jakarta at 1PM. Inflight service on both flights are good meal served is adequate with plenty of drink service. Cabin staff friendly and willing to help. . Only drawback is their entertainment inflight as the flight lasted around 4 hours and it would be better to have PTV in each seat rather than overhead screen.

October 13 YVR to MNL Business class on a 777-300. Very comfortable seating great service and reasonably good food (only ate breakfast). These seats are almost flat bed seats with a minor recline when fully extended. I was able to sleep for 7 hours on my side without slipping to the floor - pretty good.

Oct 10th Vancouver to Manila flight PR 117 A340. Oct 12th Manila to General Santos flight PR 454V A320. Their website needs a makeover as it has too many pages with jumbled information one needs to search out web check in instead of having it on the front page. It needs to add an APP to make it easier for the busy traveller to use his smart phone to check in not just to use it as a boarding ticket. The staff also needs to understand web check in as the three terminals I used (Vancouver Manila and General Santos) had web check in lines but were not used. In Vancouver I lined up in the web check in line only to be told to go to the long regular line. The A340 long haul aircraft needs to be outfitted with an entertainment system for every seat like most world class airlines. Their recently acquired 777's have it which makes the long flights over the pacific more tolerable. Staff are exemplary always showing the level of service which put North American carriers to shame. Overall I would give them 3 stars out of 5 easily able to go higher with a few touch ups in their online system and aircraft entertainment systems.

Flew SIN-MNL-SIN. SIN-MNL flight was a 777. New plane great service but I think the movies in the inflight entertainment were the same as last May's. The MNL-SIN flight was wan old plane that with an overhead TV screen.

I was rescheduled to an earlier flight which is PR880. I was surprised to experienced their new A321. Flight PR880 was on time departing 7.45pm from Cebu to Manila. The flight attendants are all up beat and friendly. The inflight snacks was a biscuit and peanuts only. The seat in economy was fine for a short trip. The seat reclines a little and the seat slides forward. What I liked is the attentiveness of the cabin crews. After 50 minutes in the air we landed smoothly and on-time.

KTM to BKK. It is good and like others mentioned here the plane was quite old and there's no inflight entertainment. The website must be upgraded as there is no way to book online. However its worth travelling.

MNL-BKK-MNL in business class. The business class lounge at the international PAL terminal has been totally refurbished compared to the one I saw in November 2012. Its modern clean comfortable the food and drinks selection is good. En route to Bangkok by coincidence we have been embarked into an A321 maiden flight. Being a 3.5 hrs trip and a day flight comfort is not as important as for the long haul ones. However the seating was narrow without any leg rest no power sockets and no inflight entertainment which is awkward for a brand new plane of latest generation. After we took off we have been given iPads which did the job with a wide selection of movies and inflight electronic entertainment. On the way back I have been boarded into an A340 former Iberia but the experience in this case was excellent compared to the outbound route. Lie flatbed powered seats inflight entertainment (although the selection was limited to just one movie) and good service onboard. Must throw a huge commend for the attendants fantastic attentive professional all of them. Concluding for mid-short flight the experience its ok. Considering that the airline came out from tough times in the recent past it is fair to say that they did a good recovery job but from a passenger point of view there is certainly room for improvement except for the cabin crew which clearly stand out compared to most other competitors even if big names.

Our plane was downgraded from a 747 to a A340. That is the most ridiculous thing I have heard of when travelling on a long-haul international flight. Why on earth would Philippine Airlines downgrade a plane that is travelling from Manila to SFO knowing that there are hundreds of passengers on this long-haul flight? The supposed reason from the supervisor was that the 747 was under maintenance and there wasn't a back-up plane for them to use. That is ridiculous that Philippine Airlines doesn't have a back-up 747 for a long-haul flight. Because of this we spent 2 hours waiting at the check-in counter until 3 seats became available for my party (and this was accomplished by compensating passengers willing to give up their seat). Once we were on our flight the flight attendants did not clean the bathrooms at all. When you have 260+ passengers on a plane using 6 bathrooms they need to get cleaned regularly. Additionally this downgraded plane did not provide personal entertainment systems. Having personal entertainment systems should be a requirement for a long haul international flight. The only good thing about this experience was how patient the check-in associate was with us and the fact that she was able to get 3 seats open for us.

MLA to DGTE in June. Flight ended up being cancelled after 7 hours of waiting due to various unrecognizable reasons. We were already taxiing to the runway when the pilot decided to cancel the flight. Came back this month (September) and bought again a return ticket for MLA-DGTE-MLA. The outgoing flight went well although with the usual delay (2 hours) but on my return I decided to get an earlier flight from another airline because a day before the return trip I have been monitoring the airline's reliability and they were way off their declared schedules. Fearing I'd miss my international flight later that night I took the noon flight on another airline placing my afternoon flight with Air Philippines as backup. The other airline got me on time for my international flight and a phone call from my sister confirmed that I wouldn't have made it had I took Air Philippines as they arrived and left DGTE late again.

SFO-MNL-DVO-MNL-SFO. I couldn't have asked for more. Each flight I was on was excellent though I guess it all depends on what you expect. I expect to get to where I'm going as safely as possible in an aircraft that's worthy and has been cleaned and with pilots and crew that know what they're doing. Oh if there's some food and drinks fantastic. I'd fly with PAL again in a minute! Excellent!

SIN-MLA one-way Economy class on A330. The cabin looks tired. Seats are ok. Food was tasty. The flight attendants are polite but they lack the smile and hospitality that I'm used to when flying PAL. Overall experience still good. Price is cheaper as compared to other full-serviced airlines in the region. Definitely will fly again on this airline.

Flew B777-300er to Canada. Delayed 1 hour due to some technical problems and miscommunications between ground staff. The cabin was pleasantly relaxing generous legroom with inflight entertainment monitors each seat offering lots of good movies games and music. Food was tasty it satisfied my palate crew were very friendly professional immaculately neat and well groomed. Philippine Airlines is improving now becoming more competitive I would say. Will definitely fly with them again In the future.

DVO-MNL-NGO the service was good and the meals are based on Japanese taste. The seats though not first class were comfortable leg room was sufficient. The cabin crew were very friendly and hospitality to each passenger. I will choose to fly PAL again.
Manila-Melbourne 21.00 hrs on their new fleet Airbus A340 and was very impressed. As you would expect modern seating everything worked lots of space and great value for money.

July 2013 we flew CGK-MNL-CGK. Used credit card to purchase tickets online through official PAL website when we checked-in we were not asked to show the credit card used to purchase ticket. During the flight hot meal was a choice of chicken or beef (CGK-MNL). Also a piece of bread on the tray but no butter. No wet towels provided. Also flew MNL-LAO-MNL and MNL-CEB-MNL on PAL not one departed on time (weather good no typhoon). Bought domestic tickets online (separately) didn't notice that baggage allowance could be different for the trip to LAO and CEB (10 kg & 20 kg respectively). Found out later that baggage allowance for domestic flights depends on the price you pay for the ticket but no such information before you click purchase. Since PAL is a full-service airline I think baggage allowance should be 20kg for economy class at whatever price you pay.

LAX-MNL-LAX June - July 2013. Outbound flight delayed due to late arrival of aircraft went non-stop to Manila seat was good - had the bulkhead seat row 45. Leg room adequate flight attendants very nice food was adequate - served snack in between meals. On return left the gate on time but had to return to the gate due to some mechanical problem causing a delay of 2 hrs. Seat was better this time had another bulkhead seat row 32 HJK. 32 H was excellent with nothing in front of you flight attendants were the same very nice food. AVOD did not work in my seat but was given IPAD by flight attendant which has similar movies and music.

Flew via PAL Express flight in NAIA T3. (2P-971 MNL-TAC) last June aboard their newest A320 in their fleet (RP- C8399). Courteous and friendly Flight Attendants.. having free biscuits nuts and coffee/water served on board (even they classified as LCC). Interior smells like brand new car. Even my co-passengers upon arrival told that the service of PR/PAL Express is nice.

Booked from Abu Dhabi to Manila via Bahrain on Etihad and Philippine Airlines (code share flight with Gulf Air). Etihad was great but Philippine Airlines (Gulf Air) was terrible as I could not chose an Aisle seat and also could not do online check-in. I am a bit taller and I always choose an Aisle seat for comfort imagine travelling 10 hours in a middle seat - cramped! Terrible experience. I have to travel again on 5th August 2013 and still no one from the airline is ready to help.

BKK-KTM economy. B-757 though ageing the aircraft was nice and clean. Good language skills with very friendly cabin staff. Captain provided plenty of information. Food was served hot and delicious. I would certainly recommend Nepal Airlines on that price.

HKG-MNL-LAX (JUL 12 2013). Flight from MNL to LAX was delayed 4 hours. Old and worn out plane for both flights. No personal entertainment screen which is terrible considering it's a 13 hour flight. Food is OK but the portions are way too small. The only thing that could have redeemed this airline was if their cabin crews are friendly and hospitable enough - but they aren't. There were Malaysian passengers who were requesting the vegetarian meal but they did not request it online / before the flight. Ideally an airline should be prepared for such situations. It was very disappointing how the cabin crew handled such thing. Makes me wonder what kind of training they undergo. They should learn a lot from Singapore airlines crew. PAL crews will serve food then disappear and reappear again when the next meal is to be served. Again learn from Singapore airlines.
Flight from Manila to Korea with Airbus A340 was good enough! The plane does not have the Video Entertainment to watch! Not recommended to fly again! They're still using the old plane.

Flew return LAX-MNL-LAX in April 2013. Outbound delayed 2 hrs due computer problems. Boarded 747 aircraft. Looked very old and worn. Only movie screen was on bulkhead. No seatback video. Food was small portions for 17 hr flight with stop in GUM for fuel. Flt Attnd's very friendly. Some value for ticket but not enough to make me want to fly PAL again. Return trip to LAX was A340. Again very worn and not new by any standard. No video or entertainment of any kind - was broken. After meal service apx 2 hrs after take off flt attnds disappeared and occasionally would see one walking from front to back quickly. Poor service old worn out aircraft and no in flight entertainment of any kind. Would not fly PAL again for any reason. They are the bottom of the list for comfort convenience or customer service.

I flew round trip from San Francisco to Manila in Mabuhay (business) class in January 2013. There is no first class on the planes. The Mabuhay Lounge at SFO offered a superb light dinner. Business class was only half full. I had no one sitting next to me. Flight attendants addressed me formally by name and went out of their way to provide my requested food and beverages. Although the seat did not fully recline the seat plus the superb leg rest gave me enough room to curl up and sleep well. On the return which I had to make ahead of my schedule for personal reasons there was only one Mabuhay class seat available on the main deck of the 747 and the check-in agent obtained permission from the supervisor to assign it to me. The food in the Manila Mabuhay Lounge was superb-enough variety for a delicious complete dinner. My seat was in the first row of the plane which meant that I could place my carry-on in a closet in front of my seat rather than in an inconvenient overhead bin. I had the aisle seat but the person in the window seat had enough room to walk around the front of my seat and I was not disturbed during my sleep. Once again I was addressed by the crew by my title and surname and the food and beverage selection and service were superb. The outbound flight was two hours early as the light load enabled it to skip refuelling in Guam. The return flight was on time.

Vancouver to Manila flight. A 777 airplane. Landed at Manila International Airport Terminal 2. Positives: Very friendly staff Prompt service of meals and snacks Some extras - toothbrush toothpaste morning face towel Fun amusing safety video Clean Individual video screens. Touch screen. Negatives: Middle of the night snacking - they turn the lights on thereby "forcing" everyone to wake up to eat the snack. In flight entertainment of movies does allow you to select the latest movies among the rest of the movie selections. During the duty free shopping time FAs were very noisy and in our section there were 6-7 of them. They were passing items over the heads of passengers. It was very noisy and invasive of passenger space and peace. Tons of babies on the flight. Very noisy. When passengers were seated you still have lots of seat transfers because they have this policy of charging people $50 or $20 if you wanted to move to economy plus or to an exit row. Instead of having some peace of mind you have loud speaking passengers asking questions then moving their hand baggage to their new seats.

HKG - Manila return. Flight out was 3.5 hours delayed and not even the merest hint of an apology on board. We were provided with a 75 HK$ meal voucher at check-in. On board the seat pitch is very good and the crew were courteous and professional. Planes are quite dated but fine. The return flight was only 20 minutes late and the meal was delicious. It was one of the tastiest meals I've had on about 300 flights over the last 15 years. I just wish PAL could be more reliable in terms of scheduling as hanging around the airport for 3.5 hours late at night is not fun at all.

PR512 SIN-MNL. After a rather lacklustre MNL-SIN leg (an early morning flight marred by dismal FA service and attitude) I was optimistic that the outbound leg was merely a fluke. Check in at Changi and the ground staff messed up seat assignments (I traveled with 3 children and we were separated on the flight - good thing we were able to switch with a friendly lady so we can sit together). Flight delayed an hour out of Singapore and FA attitude was exactly the same as our outbound flight. Service was hurried cold and distant. Food was inedible. Good thing we had dinner at Changi before the flight. I really wish PAL would pay more attention to the people skills of their staff.

Booked 2 tickets leaving June 30 and coming back July 5 PR 119 and PR118. Staff seemed very tired I pressed the button for stewardess attention she passed by me several times until I physically had to touch her and tell her I needed a glass of water. The food quality falls below the standard for international airlines there were no snacks served in between meals. Flight duration between Toronto to Vancouver was 4 hours and from Vancouver to Manila 12 hrs. At check in we were asked to pay $20 per person to get a better economy seat even though we paid $4200 for the ticket. The only advantage was that you don't need to change planes between Toronto to Manila.

Our family of 5 went to Boracay for vacation last week (starting May 16). Manila-Kalibo on May 16 Kalibo-Manila on May 19 5.15pm. Trip going to Kalibo was ok however I was shocked to receive an email advisory from PAL on Saturday night at 6.35pm that we have been re-booked from our May 20 5.15pm flight to May 20 6.30am instead! It is impossible to get from Boracay island to Kalibo by that hour. CS agent and supervisor were insisting we either take the 6.30am May 20 flight or do a "go-show" for their 8pm or 10pm or 12.15am flights. I had to stay on the line with their CS Supervisor until he finally got us confirmed seats on May 20 4.15pm flight. In all of this all PAL could say was "sorry for the inconvenience". I will avoid this airline from now on.

Flew PR 511 MNL-SIN on 19 May 2013 in coach. PAL doesn't have online check in for international flights. Fortunately flight was fairly empty and an early morning flight and check in meant that the airport was not as crowded as usual. Painless going through check in with a full compliment of baggage from the family (wife and 3 kids). Immigration and security was a breeze. Because of the few number of passengers on this 6am flight boarding was easy. In fact the plane was fully loaded a good 20 mins before scheduled push back from the terminal. The good part of the flight ended there. I knew beforehand that there was no personal entertainment on PAL's A330 so I loaded the kids' gadgets with entertainment to keep them occupied for the 3 plus hour flight (an eternity in kids' clocks). What ruined the flight for me was the FAs attitudes of just going through the motions of completing the cabin service. It was rushed and no effort was made to accommodate passengers' requests. My wife's aisle cart ran out of the beef option but mine was stocked with it. When she requested for the beef she was merely told they ran out. I had to point out to the FA in her aisle to get the selection from the other cart. The food was pretty tasty for airline food though. Twice requested for coffee and it never came. No after meal drink run and the FAs were just in the galley chatting away. I recall the time when the saving grace of Philippine Airlines was the friendly and efficient service of the staff. Now they seem to even be losing that. I never thought I'd live long enough to see the day when I had better service from American FAs (was on Delta a few months ago) than from Philippine Airlines' FAs.

Have flown PAL twice now from Melbourne to Manila first time was so so plane was late taking off but on board service was fine. Flew again in April and was pleasantly surprised by the improvement in the airline flight on time cabin crew were very friendly and welcoming. Am a bit disappointed they are cutting out the direct Melbourne to Manila flight. All in all no complaints though their terminal is a bit small and stuffy.

Recently flew from Toronto to Manila Flit# 119 and returned Flit# 118 with Philippine Airlines. The crew onboard the flight were very professional courteous and made sure everyone was comfortable through the entire journey. The seats though not first class were comfortable leg room was sufficient food was good no complaints here. If I am ever to return to the Philippines for another vacation I will once again choose PAL.

Had a fairly pleasant flight but the plane (A330 Singapore to Manila in economy) was very old and rickety. A small number of common TVs down the centreline that skipped and lost sound constantly. Old seats aggressive aircon and everything just didn't seem very well put together. Good food and staff though.

New B777-300ER from Manila to Toronto. They were excellent and for the price their product is hard beat. Staff were excellent and service was outstanding. The wine selection leaves something to be desired but their food was creative although portions were small. The aircraft was clean and seats were comfortable. They are not fully horizontal but for me they were comfortable.

Hong Kong - Manila return service has improved since I last flew them. A340 out and 747 on return were comfortable with excellent seat pitch in economy. B747 had good AVOD. A hot meal is provided which is a welcome return to service and cabin crew are polite and efficient. The first leg was on time but the flight from Manila was dreadful as we were boarded 45 minutes late (terminal 2 is far inferior to terminal 3 - hot crowded noisy and like a greenhouse) but then sat on the stifling plane to sweat for a further 2 hours. Looking at the flight I may stick with Cebu Pacific in future as the PAL terminal building is awful and the very long hot delay was not at all acceptable.

MNL-YVR. Airbus A340-300. The seat was ok. It has quite a big legroom for a tall man like me. The food was delicious the cabin was clean the Flight attendants have great service. In flight Entertainment is poor.

MNL-YVR on a Boeing 777. Service was good and the food and beverages were tasty. My seat was a window seat and was comfortable. The seat was reclining and the cabin was clean we were given blankets. Enjoyed the inflight entertainment.

On line booking is a challenge and needs an upgrade. I didn't get the seat I booked online for an additional fee. The staff member behind the counter did not speak English nor Filipino. On our way back same thing happened the seat I booked was not given to us. This time the staff member admitted their lack of upgrades in the computer system and worked on changing our seats fast and was apologetic. Never had an on time flight with PAL. The only thing good about it is the cabin crews. They are very nice. Mine and my husband's TV did not work.
GUM-MNL-LAO and back. Mediocre Airline. No inflight entertainment No Lounge access at GUM and LAO. Nothing that makes this airline stand-out from the rest.
Nice flight from Manila to Cebu. Plane was very new and the staff very friendly. All in all a perfect flight for this short distance!
Great service from Manila to Toronto. Meals are tasty lounge is not that elegant but it is clean. Onboard seats are relaxing. Would definitely fly again.

Manila - Puerto Princesa - Manila (domestic travel). 5 day trip: delayed 3 hours on both legs. Poor communication lack of explanations and terrible customer service. The standard of this is airline is far below that of a budget airline and I will avoid flying with PR in future. A highly disorganised domestic carrier to be avoided.

Hong Kong to Manila in January 2013 on an A330. Upon arrival in Hong Kong the plane was delayed so we went out of Hong Kong approx 30 mins late. The Service was slow and my selection of food was not available. Also they apparently didn't have any Coke available. Upon arrival in Manila I couldn't help notice that the cabin staff were still cleaning up in the galley just a few minutes before our touch down in Manila. As a European I'm used to that the cabin is usually ready for arrival at least 15 minutes before touch down. There was no personal monitors however for a 2 hour flight that's not an issue for me. They did show some entertainment on a common screen but I didn't watch it. The messages from the captain were good and easy to understand.

Return Vancouver - Manila return on Boeing777. Online booking got me a good seat in the front - not what I call the second class business class back one compartment same as on the Airbus 340. The 777 is not as new as I expected but much better than the tired old 340s. Seats are a bit complicated to figure out with all the controls. Pitch is excellent with lots of room and I had nobody beside me on both legs. This was good as there are no seat pockets to store books or any items. The 777 is better configured and has a nice AVOD system although the choices were somewhat limited in music and TV shows. On the return leg the system crashed at the half way point and never came back on. The 777 is about one hour faster than the 340 and makes the trip a bit faster which is a bonus. Food was okay and service very good and attentive. My last 340 flight last year the cabin crew disappeared after dinner service but on this flight they were always around. On time flights and spacious. Will travel again next year on the 777 for sure - good value.
BKK-MLA. Nice flight with good service. The food was good and the flight attendants delightful. Not much inflight entertainment.

MNL-YVR-LAS return. The flight attendants were generally pleasant and accommodating but slow. The food was good - 4 meals plus one snack for a 14-hour flight so more than sufficient. The seats are not very comfortable they do not support the back or neck well. Fine for short flights but not good for long trips. The seats in the middle rows have ample leg room though the seats by the windows are quite cramped. As for the in-flight entertainment - there is no provision for personal entertainment only a large LCD screen with poor image quality. The same movie was shown twice. Interior of the cabin is not very well-maintained. There were scuff marks the seat covers were not pristine the passenger pamphlets tattered and there was some rubbish left behind by the previous passengers. 3 of the 6 restrooms in Economy had clogged toilets and sinks.

Nov 15 MNL to SIN economy class. The seats are okay and comfortable. The food is excellent and tasty. The cabin crew as always serve with a smile. Aircraft used was A320 and the seats were quite empty at the back of the plane (where I was seated). As to Inflight entertainment this is where I hope they can still further improve. The monitors are shared among the passengers so if you are seated above the monitor or too far then you might find it hard to watch. But at any rate overall the service is okay.

Booked a one-way ticket from Manila to Melbourne. The last time I flew PAL was 4 years ago and I can say that there is a big improvement in terms of service. I only wish they'd start online check-ins. The in-flight entertainment as well as food and beverages were adequate.

I was forewarned about glitches at check-in due to a computer system upgrade so was prepared for the worst. An agent assisted passengers it was no consolation because check-in seemed to take forever with my frequent flyer number missing and likewise my pre-reserved seat. Commendation however should be given to the in-flight crew who did a superb job with their pleasant service attitude. Food was ample and delicious but where it lacked was in presentation. Midnight snacks offered after dinner which helped quell my hunger due to the long flight (flight skipped the Guam technical stop and so it became a long 14 hour non-stop flight LAX-MNL). Since I flew on a similar aircraft MNL-LAX 19 days earlier I was disappointed however that the legroom on this 747-400 was shorter than the aircraft I flew on earlier. Having been a regular flyer of Philippine Airlines I was pleasantly surprised at the enhancements experienced on over-all service on these flights.

Flew SFO-MNL-BKK. Aircraft 747 was adequate. Compared to top tier carriers Philippine Airlines Business Cabin is cheaper with enough legroom and great food. Staff friendly and attentive. Generally I fly Thai or Singapore to BKK but Philippine Airlines offered the best quality of service for Business travelers for the cheapest fares in Business Class. Would recommend for those who want to save but still have a quality of service.

MNL-BKK-MNL. Wouldn't normally fly Business Class but found a bargain fare. Was assigned a seat in the former First Class cabin of an old A340 with seats and legroom a couple of notches better than the regular Business Class cabins. Seat showed its age but well maintained and comfortable; was able to lower it into an almost flat position and managed to have a very good nap. Staff attentive and their enthusiasm seemed quite genuine. Nothing fancy in the meal service but the food was tasty and plenty of it - ask for the excellent mango smoothie! Inflight entertainment was sub-par not even as good as economy in the top-tier airlines. Overall very satisfied and will gladly fly with them again.
I flew PAL for the first time on a trip to Manila and Bangkok from Honolulu. The service was good and food was tasty. Flight Attendants were courteous and friendly.

YVR–MNL-YVR (Aug 26 Sep 10). The service was great. The flight attendants were always available to assist passengers and several times they go around to give water and snacks. They serve dinner and breakfast. The food is tasty and comparable with other Asian airlines. The B777-300 aircraft is spotless the legroom is ample the seat will recline and it has personal entertainment system with good selections of movies games and music. Overall PAL did a good job and I will fly with them again.

BKK-MNL business class on the refurbished B747. Flight on time. Meals were tasty. Legroom was ample and seat reclined to around 160 degrees. Asked flight purser to reserve an item for me from their duty-free upon delivery and she gladly delivered it to me right after a few minutes even before take-off. AVOD was also working and offered several options.
BXU-MNL-HKG-MNL. Basically on time all sectors. As all sectors were 2 hrs or less didn't really miss fancy entertainment system. Cabin crew were good as was the food.

Flight 102 from Manila to LAX July 15 2012 returning home to LA from lovely trip to Thailand. We flew from Bangkok to Manila then Manila to LAX. First flight delayed by 5 hours which prevented us from taking the original second flight. The airline did a good job of trying to reach us about it ground staff in Bangkok did a good job of getting us onto a later flight and ground staff in Manila airport did a good superb job of expediting us from the first flight to the second which had been held for us and seven other people who had the same problem. It had been held an entire hour waiting for those last 9 passengers - with all other passengers on board and apparently no AC. Plane felt like a sauna when we boarded. From here it all goes down hill. This was the most uncomfortable plane I have ever been on. Very little legroom and the seats were unusually narrow so no elbow room. When the guy in front tilted his chair back it felt uncomfortable and intrusive. Food was average except for the fluffy cake desserts. Service was adequate some attendants were nice but others seemed apathetic. We would not choose Philippine Airlines again.

The new Boeing 777 on the Australia routes (serving MEL and SYD from MNL) makes a huge difference as it has AVOD. Flights were full in economy in both directions with excellent punctuality coming back but half an hour late or so on the forward journey. Overall a good experience.

My flight from Iloilo to Manila and on to Los Angeles was really good. The food was good but the inflight entertainment was pretty bad. However I think they are getting new inflight entertainment so I would recommend PAL.

MNL-YVR-MNL. The service is impeccable. Check-in is a breeze. From ground crew to cabin crew they were hospitable and assist you all the time. Long Haul Business Class is just smooth for nearly 12 hours flight and the entertainment is indeed good. Food is good though it needs more presentation.

Manila to Vancouver April 15 2012. Crowded flight-terminal hot and waiting area over flowing with passengers-long evasive pre-flight baggage check. Plane an old Airbus 340. Seats adequate. Entertainment system terrible with only three channels one so fuzzy could not watch it. Plane was hot and complained twice to no avail. Passenger to my left had a caregiver to attend to her and she blocked the aisle for 30 % of the flight. Staff were pleasant enough and food adequate. Prices have increased to the point where it is poor value for the money. I asked to be seated in the premium business section as I have been a Mabuhay member since 2005. I was refused and I know the section was almost empty. Will never fly PAL again to Canada.

3 flight delays in one trip! HKG-Manila-Tagbilaran City Bohol. For the first flight when we arrived the boarding gate there was no aircraft at HKG for Manila. We waited an hour for departure and arrived in Manila one hour later than scheduled. We asked the crews and interestingly they said the connecting flight to Tagbilaran city would wait for us. After we landed we rushed to transfer desk and were informed that the connecting flight had already departed. Subsequently the airline scheduled us for an early flight the next morning. Arranged shuttle to and from hotel. Return flight from Tagbilaran City to Manila delayed 20mins. When we reached the boarding gate for connecting flight back HKG we almost missed the flight with only 8 mins to spare. No one helped us through the domestic terminal to the international airport. However the flight back HKG was delayed again. Overall total: 25% on time rate!

I am waiting for my international flight as we speak and I have never been on such a disorganized airline! After passing several gates and several metal detectors and waiting in several lines I wanted to sit relax eat and wander around and shop until my flight. Unfortunately that is not happening because we had to go through an additional line baggage screening pat down and talk to more people at their kiosk! We could not have our water that we just bought inside the gate area and now we are stuck in a roped off area at our gate unable to go out and have lunch or a drink of water! I am so frustrated if only they had checked all of our stuff properly at the gate entrance there would not be this problem of waiting and not being able to leave. This is the first time using Philippine Airlines and I will not be using them again.

CEB-MNL I was excited to try their Mabuhay Class onboard their brand new B777-300ER. I had a great time with them. Check-in was a breeze and boarding was smooth for business class. Seat was very comfortable and I could fly that seat for 16 hours with no discomfort. The B777 features an AVOD. Food was average though it was a pasta meal they served on business class. Landing was smooth as always. I will definitely fly them again.

Manila to Vancouver. The seat was ok not too crowded nice screen on the seat back to watch movies etc. The female stewardesses were rude with no please or thank you. I had no blanket when I asked the stewardess she told me if it wasn't on my seat it was too bad as there were no more. Aircraft was good  service staff need to be brought up to standards!

Good food could have done with more liquid refreshment baby bassinet on floor meaning no legroom in bulkhead row reasonable AVOD IFE no airshow (map) on entire plane on return journey. Terrible terminal at MNL for arrivals (1hr wait for immigration 1.5 hr wait for baggage) terrible terminal at MNL for departures (cannot buy liquids airside despite going through 2x security lines little to eat few places to sit aircon broken down). I've flown with Cebu Pacific and PAL before and used all 3 terminals at MNL but this is by far the worst experience so far in so many ways.
MNL to Tag Bohol. Flight on time flight attendants very professional and service was great. Quite expensive but I will definitely fly them again.

Travelled PR several times already both on International and Domestic routes and on both J and Y class. Impressed that no flight was delayed. Their new safety video catches one's attention. Food is not the best but not the worst one either. PAL may be a bit expensive compare to other local airlines but you get what you paid for.

Cotabato (RPMC) to Manila (RPLL). I was not impressed nor disappointed. Flight delayed 45 minutes. The service was fine. The cabin crew were very professional very informative displays however their inflight snack was a let down. Aircraft was an Airbus A319. Although there was enough leg room the space is still so limited that you cannot go to the washroom without disturbing other passengers. My return flight to Cotabato was a little bit better. Delayed only 20 minutes the plane was Airbus A320 the snack was a little better considering they served coffee that day and the cabin crew professional as always. However the cabin was too hot.

MNL-PEK-MNL on an airbus 320. New clean with good legroom even in economy. No personal AVOD only overhead screens but a good movie selection. Both flights on time and inflight catering was good with ice cream served. Flight attendants very professional.

Hostesses were great the plane was clean and the food average. The entertainment was below standard on the flight from Melbourne to Manila I could only see a screen 8 rows in front of me in the next section. They need to lift their game to get more westerners to fly with them. If you want the whole package fly Singapore or New Zealand.

BKK-MNL-KLO return O/N in Manila on outbound trip. First leg non-refurbished 747-400 A319 on flights to and from KLO and A330 return to BKK. All flights were delayed IFE was on overhead monitors and bulkhead screen. Seat comfort was okay service was professional. Vegetarian Meal was tasty and drinks snacks and ice cream were served. Some passengers weren't given their meal preference as it had run out and were given what was left. Overall experience was not bad but not great either. I flew PAL for the scheduling and destinations and would fly with them again based on price and routing.

Cancelled flight from Cebu to Narita and didn't tell the passengers until after 8 hours waiting in the terminal. Never offered any compensation. Plane left the following day like nothing happened and everything was normal. A truly non-caring airline towards customers.

MNL-CEB-MNL. No problems with check-in and security in Manila. NAIA Terminal 2 was a bit spartan but much nicer compared to the dreaded old NAIA 1. Boarding this non-AVOD A330 (filthy inside and out) and departing 30 minutes behind schedule. No blankets or pillows offered. No service except for some peanuts/crackers and coffee/tea/water. Safety video not played and a live manual demo was done. Overhead screens not functioning not even the airshow. Inflight magazine missing from all Economy Class seats. Seats fairly comfortable legroom much better than Cebu Pacific but lesser than Korean Air. Carpets and footrest are filthy. Cebu airport is in a bad state though check-in was not a hassle. Return flight on A330 equipment change from a 747. Same complaints concerning the overhead bins and food/drinks however this time overhead screens were functioning but only airshow was shown and a live safety demo was done in lieu of airing a safety video. In short mediocre (but not poor) experience.

Generally good service and comfortable flight purchased ticket on Philippine Airlines where the website stated it included a meal. This was a small packet of peanuts and soft drink! This does not represent good value when compared to the other budget airlines operating in the Philippines. Flights are often delayed cancelled or simply amalgamated with flights of their sister airline Phil Air Express.
SGD-MNL. Check-in was fast and the ground crew were friendly. The plane took of with a 10 min delay. The food was really good and were provided with blankets for the night flight.
